title: Mirror images - image size when object is moved

content.question: An object is placed in front of a concave mirror at a location where the image formed by the mirror is at the same location as the object. The object is then moved a short distance closer to the mirror. What happens to the size of the image, and what evidence or reasoning helps support the claim?

choices.label: The image increases in size. When the object is moved a short distance closer to the mirror, the image moves farther from the mirror.
The image increases in size. When the object is moved a short distance closer to the mirror, the image moves even closer to the mirror than the object.
The image decreases in size. When the object is moved a short distance closer to the mirror, the image moves farther from the mirror.
The image decreases in size. When the object is moved a short distance closer to the mirror, the image moves even closer to the mirror than the object.

content.answer: The image increases in size. When the object is moved a short distance closer to the mirror, the image moves farther from the mirror.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
